name: Pimiento de Padrón
description: A small, mild chili pepper from Padrón, Spain. It is typically served fried and sprinkled with salt, although some can be surprisingly spicy.

name: Cherry Pepper
description: Also known as pimiento pepper, it is a sweet, cherry-shaped pepper often used in pickling and as a stuffing for olives.

name: Pimiento del Piquillo
description: Originating from Spain, this red pepper is sweet and slightly spicy. It is often roasted, peeled, and used in various dishes and tapas.

name: Sweet Banana Pepper
description: This elongated, mild pepper has a tangy and sweet flavor. It is commonly used in salads, sandwiches, and pickled form on pizzas.

name: Pimiento de Gernika
description: Hailing from Gernika, Spain, this pepper is similar to Pimiento de Padrón. It is typically fried and served as a popular Basque dish.

name: Hungarian Wax Pepper
description: A medium-hot chili pepper with a waxy yellow color that matures to red. It is commonly used in Hungarian cuisine, salsa, and pickling.

name: Anaheim Pepper
description: A mildly spicy pepper that originates from New Mexico but is commonly associated with California cuisine. It is often used in salsas and roasted dishes.

name: Pepperoncini
description: Also known as Tuscan peppers, these mild chili peppers are often pickled and used as a tangy addition to salads, sandwiches, and antipasti.
